image.altText: Bill Shorten looks stern as he addresses the media

props.synopsis: Cabinet minister and former union leader Bill Shorten says he expects the ALP to ban all donations from the embattled CFMEU when the party's executive meets today.

title.children: Shorten says Labor will not be 'taking any CFMEU money anymore'

image.altText: A court sketch of Jason Richard Struhs, who wears glasses and has facial hair.

props.synopsis: Jason and Kerrie Struhs and 12 others members of their fringe church are charged over the death of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs in January 2022.

title.children: Elizabeth Struhs's father asked nurse for proof she was sick after her mother urged him to stop treatment, court hears

image.altText: Two policemen watch as a yellow crane truck lifts a metal box in grassland.

props.synopsis: The victims of the toolbox murders were beaten and forced into a metal box, which was then dumped in a dam in south of Brisbane.

title.children: Man jailed over role in Queensland's toolbox murders has name cleared

image.altText: Jarome Luai and Mitchell Moses embrace after the Blues won State of Origin III.

props.synopsis: Jarome Luai provides the Blues with the game-changing moment in their 14-4 win over the Maroons that clinches their first State of Origin series in three years, while a melee spills over the sideline and Billy Slater plays mind games before the match. Here are the five quick hits from a pulsating Game III.

title.children: Five quick hits: Luai steps up in Blues' Origin triumph, tempers flare and Slater throws pre-match curveball

image.altText: Mitchell Moses grimaces as a NSW Blues trainer touches his bicep during the State of Origin decider.

props.synopsis: Mitch Moses scores the first try of his Origin career as the Blues end Queensland's State of Origin winning streak, but suffers a bicep injury that could have repercussions for Parramatta.

title.children: 'It's gone': Mitch Moses suffers potentially season-ending injury in drought-breaking Blues win

image.altText: picture of a man and woman, a stamp and paper split seperates them

props.synopsis: A radical sovereign citizen group co-invented by a fugitive mother is using a fake court to justify attempted child abduction, extortion, and intimidation of court officials.

title.children: Why Scott has gone to 'war' with his ex-partner and her 'delusional cult'

image.altText: An a

props.synopsis: James Copenhaver and David "Jake" Dutch are in a stable condition after Thomas Matthew Crooks opened fire during a Trump rally in the town of Butler.

title.children: What we know about the two men critically injured during the attempted assassination of Donald Trump

image.altText: A man smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Officials and victims' loved ones gather near Amsterdam to mark the 10-year anniversary of MH17 being shot down, as Australian Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus tells the crowd the tragedy deepened the bonds between his country and the Netherlands.

title.children: 'I haven't lost hope': Memorial service held near Amsterdam to mark 10-year anniversary of MH17 disaster

image.altText: WA Liberal Senator Linda Reynolds with her lawyer Martin Bennett speaking to the media

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds wins a legal bid to access the details of a protective trust into which Brittany Higgins put funds from her $2.4 million settlement with the Commonwealth.

title.children: Brittany Higgins's $2.4m Commonwealth payout at risk after Linda Reynolds wins court ruling

image.altText: An image of former Queensland police commissioner Jim O'Sullivan

props.synopsis: Jim O'Sullivan AC, who served as Queensland's 17th police commissioner and was instrumental in addressing police corruption in Queensland, has been remembered as a "good police officer, a good police commissioner, and a good man".

title.children: 'Dedicated to serving the people of Queensland': Former police commissioner Jim O'Sullivan dies

image.altText: A police officer inspects packets of powder

props.synopsis: Indonesian authorities say the boat, carrying 106 kilograms of the highly addictive drug, had been travelling from Singapore to Brisbane when it was discovered by customs agents.

title.children: Indonesian police intercept massive 100-kilogram shipment of the drug ice heading for Australia

image.altText: A side-on photo of a man wearing a blue suit, white shirt and yellow tie gesturing with his right hand while speaking on stage.

props.synopsis: Andrew 'Twiggy' Forrest will axe 700 jobs from mining company Fortescue by the end of July to streamline business.

title.children: Andrew Forrest's Fortescue slashes 700 jobs amid green technology commitment

image.altText: dead trees

props.synopsis: In what the local government described as a "reprehensible" act, 69 jarrah and marri trees were poisoned with glyphosate along a gravel road in Redmond, near Albany on Western Australia's south coast.

title.children: Remorseful farmer offers to revegetate after admitting to poisoning dozens of native trees

image.altText: Five soldiers in camouflage walk through a wooded area carrying boxes on their backs

props.synopsis: South Korea says soldiers from the North have been working in appalling conditions to place tens of thousands of additional explosives along the border between the two countries, with summer rainfall a risk of moving them.

title.children: South Korea warns of floating landmines as North expands explosives program along border

image.altText: A 3D model of the Trump rally shooting.

props.synopsis: To get a better understanding of the position of the shooter in relation to the US Secret Service snipers, the ABC has recreated the scene of the fatal rally in Pennsylvania.

title.children: Here's what 3D modelling reveals about what snipers could and couldn’t see moments before shots rang out

image.altText: Uncontatced tribe on a beach

props.synopsis: The largest uncontacted tribe in the world has been filmed just miles from a number of logging concessions, sparking fresh calls from campaigners to protect the land.

title.children: New footage shows 'uncontacted' Mashco Piro tribe in Peruvian Amazon under threat of logging

image.altText: A man wearing a tracksuit top over a shirt with an 'adidas' logo looks straight at the camera unsmiling.

props.synopsis: Christopher Tomas Dimer fatally stabbed his partner of four years in Perth after she suffered years of abuse at his hands, a WA court hears.

title.children: Murder trial hears man deliberately stabbed partner to death after years of domestic violence

image.altText: A man in a camel-coloured overcoat smiles.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason is alleged to have pushed a woman into a mantelpiece, causing bruising and concussion. His legal counsel says Justice Geason's defence relies on questioning the woman's "sobriety" and her "ability to recall things".

title.children: 'You were so drunk': Barrister tries to discredit woman's account of alleged assault by Supreme Court judge

image.altText: Pam, partner and furniture

props.synopsis: Amid the increasing demand on outreach services, some communities are banding together to try and bridge the gap for those struggling to make ends meet.

title.children: As the cost-of-living crisis takes its toll on Australians, some are looking outside the box for solutions

image.altText: A woman next to children's toys

props.synopsis: Jacqui Cooper is grateful to be in remission from the rare cancer that stole her ability to walk or look after her son, but advocates for patients say sarcoma still does not receive enough research funding.

title.children: Brisbane mum 'lucky' to receive early diagnosis for forgotten cancer often missed by doctors

image.altText: Sally McManus standing in front of an ACTU banner.

props.synopsis: The peak union body has voted to suspend the construction division of the CFMEU and urged its leadership to support plans to install an independent administrator to clean up the union.

title.children: ACTU suspends CFMEU as government moves to clean up union

image.altText: Bushra is seen in medical scrubs, and a PANZMA cap, preforming surgery in Gaza.

props.synopsis: An exclusive interview with an Australian surgeon, Dr Bushra Othman, who went on a medical mission to Gaza in the middle of the Israel-Gaza war. She describes what she went through in Gaza as "unfathomable" and says the enclave's healthcare system is hanging on by a thread.

title.children: Australian surgeon returns home from Gaza after operating in 'unfathomable' conditions

image.altText: The couple stand holding a koala

props.synopsis: The suspect in the killings of Australian couple David James Fisk and Lucita Barquin Cortez and their Filipina companion at at a luxury resort in the Philippines has surrendered.

title.children: Police say suspect in killing of Australian couple in Philippines 'wanted to get back at the hotel for his dismissal'

image.altText: An aerial view of single storey red brick house on a suburban street

props.synopsis: Officials are yet to determine 20-year-old Thomas Crooks's motive for carrying out the attack on former president Donald Trump at a Pennsylvania rally.

title.children: Investigators check laptop, phone of Trump shooter as more details emerge about assassination attempt

image.altText: IMF提升了对美国和中国在2024年的经济预测。

props.synopsis: Keeping interest rates too high for too long could have disastrous economic consequences, the IMF has warned in its latest report.

title.children: 'Risk of major financial fallout' as IMF sounds the alarm on persistent global inflation

image.altText: Evie, Mo and Otis Maslin smiling together, shoulders up.

props.synopsis: The Australian children were killed when flight MH17 was shot down. Ten years on, their parents reveal how they found hope and peace since the tragedy.

title.children: Evie, Mo and Otis died in the MH17 tragedy. This is how their parents are remembering them

image.altText: Jill and Roger Guard smile, wearing formalwear as they pose for a photo in a sunlit garden setting.

props.synopsis: For thousands of Australians, the world changed forever on July 17, 2014. A decade later, those who knew and loved the 38 Australians who lost their lives on MH17 are determined to ensure they will never be forgotten.

title.children: A decade after the MH17 tragedy devastated Australian families, tributes burn bright

image.altText: Queensland players embrace as they celebrate defeating NSW in State of Origin III.

props.synopsis: A lot has been written about the Blues' inability to win Origin deciders in Queensland, but their record in winner-takes-all matches over 42 years is poor regardless of geography.

title.children: As Queensland hopes for another great Origin escape, the Blues are trying to disregard decades of despair

image.altText: JD Vance stands with arms folded across his chest, chin raised

props.synopsis: When Donald Trump first took office, JD Vance boldly declared he would never support him. So how did this conservative venture capitalist-turned-politician win over the former president to become his pick for Republican vice-president?

title.children: Once a self-declared 'Never Trumper', JD Vance is now aligned on everything from abortion to the war in Ukraine

image.altText: Jack Black and Kyle Gass of Tenacious D walk off stage at a concert

props.synopsis: Following a joke about the attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Sydney on Sunday night, the world of Tenacious D has gone into meltdown.

title.children: Tenacious D controversy explained: The political views and concerning future of Jack Black’s comedy band

image.altText: CFMEU generic

props.synopsis: A pathway forward on how to respond to allegations the high-profile union was infiltrated by underworld figures could become clearer when the Labor Party's national executive meets.

title.children: Claims of bikie links and intimidation: Who has oversight of the CFMEU?

image.altText: An artists impression of a large energy battery storage area.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has approved the Limestone Coast Energy Park project, which promises to be the biggest one in the state, eclipsing Tesla's 150MW battery.

title.children: SA's newly approved battery will be more than three times the size of famous 'Tesla battery'

image.altText: Jeanine Kimm in the shearing shed

props.synopsis: There are just 2,000 sheep shearers left keeping a $3.5 billion export industry alive. Rather than sit on idle hands, hardened workers are trying to entice the next generation into the shed.

title.children: 'Shear hard … have a house paid off in ten years': Bid to entice the next generation of sheep shearers
